--- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
> aseelaa wrote:
> 
> >>I'd recommend inspecting the junit/tests directory to see if 
> >>LoadedFromJar.class exists.  If it does, then ensure your 
CLASSPATH 
> >>includes the JUnit installation directory.  If it does not exist, 
> >>
> >then 
> >
> >>reinstall junit3.7.
> >>
> >>Mike
> >>
> >
> >junit.tests does contain LoadedFromJar.class.  My classpath 
already 
> >includes the Junit installation directory.  I copied code from the 
> >refactoring book, and that works fine (in all 3 interfaces), but 
the 
> >test still gives an error in the last test. I also tried running 
the 
> >junit.tests.AllTests (instead of junit.samples.Alltests), and that 
> >fails on the 63rd test (and the first 62 pass OK).
> >
> 
> Interesting.
> 
> So your CLASSPATH includes something like c:\junit, and not 
> c:\junit\junit.jar, right?
> 
> What platform are you using?
> 
> Mike
> 
> 
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
Well, it actually includes both C:\junit and junit.jar's path.  I 
have also tried adding parent and child directories and played around 
with orderings and none seems to help.
I am using Windows XP.  It is very strange, because it runs almost 
all the tests...all but the last one!!!
Do you think I should re-install?  (the tests that I am writing work 
OK though).
